title: oripathy_lesion_(arknights)
body:
A specific character design feature of [[Arknights]]. In the backstory, characters infected with "Oripathy" from exposure to the mineral [[originium (arknights)|]] eventually have originium begin to fuse with their cells; this creates "oripathy lesions" both internally and externally. These appear as black [tn](except for [[Angelina (arknights)|Angelina]] and [[ceobe (arknights)|Ceobe]] — they have blue and yellow, respectively)[/tn] originium "chips" on the body and are present in a number of the character designs for characters in the game. It is not present on all characters, however, since not every operator or character is necessarily infected (or does not yet have external lesions).

It is also a feature that many fan artists, particularly ones who are not very familiar with the property, often miss. Characters that should have oripathy lesions are often missing them in fan art and even the official art can be a little inconsistent about it ("Ifrit's Elite II":/posts/3563831 art is an infamous example).

h4. Examples
* !post #6616977: On leg
* !post #5837758: On chest
* !post #6362876: On shoulder

h4. See also

* [[infection monitor (Arknights)]]

title: spiffo_(project_zomboid)
body:
An orange [[raccoon]] featured in [[Project Zomboid]].

Originally a playable character in [i]PAWS[/i], a canceled fighting game by [i]Project Zomboid[/i] developer The Indie Stone, he now serves as the [[mascot]] for Spiffo's, an in-game fast food chain, as well as for the developers themselves.

title: gunfighter_ballads_and_trail_songs
body: A 1959 country album by Marty Robbins. [i]Gunfighter Ballads[/i] contains Robbins's best-known song, "El Paso", as well as [[big iron|"Big Iron"]], which became notorious online after it appeared in [i][[Fallout: New Vegas]][/i] in 2010.

title: big_iron
body:
A country ballad by Marty Robbins, from his 1959 album [i][[Gunfighter Ballads and Trail Songs]][/i]. "Big Iron" tells the story of an unnamed Arizona Ranger who rides into the town of Agua Fria sometime between 1901 and 1909 (the years of the original Ranger organization's existence). Unnerved by his silence and the large handgun he carries (the eponymous "big iron"), the townsfolk initially take the Ranger for an outlaw, until he explains that he is hunting a notorious outlaw called Texas Red.

Long overshadowed in Robbins's canon by "El Paso" from the same album, "Big Iron" entered 21st-century meme culture through its appearance on the soundtrack of [i][[Fallout: New Vegas]][/i] in 2010.

title: boothill_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the Galaxy Rangers. Voiced by [[Konishi Katsuyuki]] (JP) and [[Andrew Russell]] (EN). 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], [[black eyes]] with [[crosshair pupils]], and [[mechanical arms]] and [[cyborg|torso]]. His default outfit, fitting of his occupation, consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[cowboy hat]], [[bullet earrings]], [[red cape]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], [[brown belt|brown]] [[ammunition belt]], [[black pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and a [[thigh holster]] for his [[revolver]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691450: Splash art
* !post #8768050: Sailing Towards a Second Life (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
"So, here's the thing: someone went and tinkered with my Synesthesia Beacon, so now, all you folks can hear is me and those adorable little troublemakers talkin' like this... cutie, cutie, cutie. Looky here, see?"

A cyborg cowboy drifting among the stars. Extremely optimistic and unrestrained.
He is a member of the Galaxy Rangers who swore to punish the wretched by any and all means...
His flamboyant and brash actions were all to draw the attention of the Interastral Peace Corporation — the target of his revenge.
[/expand]

title: vienna_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Originally started out as a facecam streamer, she debuted her vtuber model on May 17, 2021. The model is illustrated by [[hayamafair]] and [[Live2D]] rigged by [[Brian Tsui (artist)|]].

Previously a member of [[Cloud9]] as a [[League of Legends]] content creator, she left the team after two years on February 23, 2023. She afterwards switched to [[Sonii (odyssey interactive)|]], acting as PR for Odyssey Interactive. After her internship contract ended, she came back as Vienna.

She is a [[dragon girl]] with [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]], as well a small set of [[dragon horns]]. She has a [[dragon tail]] as well, but it is not visible in all of her appearances.

h4. Costumes

* !post #5370145: [[Vienna (vtuber) (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #5361277: [[Vienna (vtuber) (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: White Dress
* !post #6333870: [[Vienna (vtuber) (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Casual
* !post #8583757: [[Vienna (vtuber) (4th costume)|4th costume]]: Primal

h4. External links

* "Twitch":[https://www.twitch.tv/vienna/]
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCN-UumTCLD7zVey1czA-75g]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/viennavtuber]
* "TikTok":[https://www.tiktok.com/@c9vienna]

title: amagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Amagi[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[high_ponytail|high]], [[wide ponytail]], [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[maple_leaf|Japanese maple]] [[leaf hair ornament]] on her ponytail. 

At base form, she wears a [[floral print|floral pattern]] [[green kimono]] with a [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] bearing her real-life [[flight deck]] camouflage pattern, and carries her banner-rod wrapped on her back. Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces painted in green, bearing her real-life bridge and [[anti-aircraft gun]]s. When she is damaged, she slumps sideways, a reference to how she was sunk in real-life.

She has a high-strung, yet still "mature woman" personality, with a lack of confidence in her abilities and constant worry about air attacks.  Her depiction in doujin works tend to run more towards the [[Yamato Nadeshiko]] end of the spectrum, focusing upon the personality implied by her unusually ornate and formal clothing in her unremodeled state.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1920004: Base
* !post #1920007: [[Amagi Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]
* !post #2229909: [[Amagi (new year) (kancolle)|New Year]]
* !post #2520006: [[Amagi (Yukata) (Kancolle)|Yukata]]

h4. [i]Unryuu[/i]-class aircraft carriers

* [[Unryuu (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Amagi[/b]
* [[Katsuragi (Kancolle)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Amagi (battlecruiser)]]
* [[Amagi (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Amagi (CV) (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wiki: Amagi":https://en.kancollewiki.net/Amagi
* "Wikipedia: Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Amagi[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Amagi]

title: amber_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A perky, straightforward girl, who is also the only Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Her amazing mastery of the glider has made her a three-time winner of the Gliding Champion in Mondstadt. As a rising star within the Knights of Favonius, Amber is always ready for any challenging tasks.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]], [[small_breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], [[brown eyes]], and fair skin. She wears a jumper-like outfit composed of dark brown leather [[shorts]], a red hoodie-like top, red [[thighhighs]], and white thigh-high [[boots]] embellished with gold linings and symbols.

Her elemental skill is [[Baron Bunny (genshin Impact)|]].

h4. Costumes
* !post #5304439: [[amber_(genshin_impact)|Default]]
* !post #5577573: [[amber_(100%_Outrider)_(genshin_impact)|100% Outrider]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Amber":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Amber]

title: maiden_with_eyes_of_blue
body:
[b]Attribute[/b]: Light
[b]Level[/b]: 1
[b]Type[/b]: Spellcaster/Tuner/Effect
[b]Effect[/b]: When a card or effect is activated that targets this card (Quick Effect): You can Special Summon 1 "Blue-Eyes White Dragon" from your hand, Deck, or GY. When this card is targeted for an attack: You can negate the attack, and if you do, change the battle position of this card, then you can Special Summon 1 "Blue-Eyes White Dragon" from your hand, Deck, or GY. You can only use 1 "Maiden with Eyes of Blue" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
[b]ATK[/b]: 0 [b]DEF[/b]: 0

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]] that is largely based on the character [[Kisara (yu-gi-oh!)|]], the women who carries the spirit of the [[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]].

title: prinz_eugen_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the third [i]Admiral Hipper[/i]-class heavy cruiser in [[Kantai Collection]]. Designed by [[Shimada Fumikane]]. Voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] tied with [[anchor_hair_ornament|anchor hair ornaments]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] similar to [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]]'s. Unlike the other Kriegsmarine girls in the game however, her uniform is not bottomless. Instead she wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[microskirt]]. She also wears short [[black thighighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]] that barely reach above her knees.

In her remodel, her uniform gains a [[camouflage]] pattern, her [[skirt]] turns [[white skirt|white]], and her turrets turn blue.

h4. Skins

* !post #1845804: Default (damaged)

title: shinsha_(tensura)
body:
Character appearing in the mobile game "That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime: Isekai Memories." 

She's considered the daughter of [[Rimuru Tempest]]. [spoiler]And she's born from the wish of [[Shuna (tensura)|Shuna]] to have a child with Rimuru.[/spoiler]

She has multiple forms. The first is her slime form, unlike Rimuru she is pink. Her second form is her human form, which is very similar to Rimuru's appearance, but her eyes are red. [spoiler]And the last form is her evolved form, now with pink hair.

title: odette_mori
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' first generation. Character design by [[3pel1]]. Also shares the same character designer with [[Nyantsume]] from the same generation, along with [[Yuri Yaneva]].

On January 24, 2025, Odette announced that she would be graduating on the same day that NEXAS shuts down after initially saying that she would keep her IP, which is on the 31st of the same month, and would be rebranding.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], [[owl ears]], a [[grey hat]] and [[pink eyes]].

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[white capelet]], a [[grey coat]], a [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[pink skirt]], [[black gloves]], a [[black bag]] with multiple [[envelope|envelopes]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black boots|black]] [[fur-trimmed boots]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]].

title: tangaroa_(housamo)
body:
The Great Creator, Tangaroa, created an island world out of his own body, drawing from his own flesh and blood to bring life to its soil, foliage, and even the surrounding sky. Slightly overprotective, he longs for the happiness of all living creatures on his island, guiding them as a father and welcoming even visitors as his own children. Though the creation of his island used up most of his original flesh, he retains form as a Staff, a Sacred Artifact comprised of his few remaining bones. Only a chosen warrior of the island tribe may possess the Staff, which imbues its wielder with Tangaroa's memories, designating the wielder an incarnation of the Great Creator, and thus, leader of the tribe.

h4.See also

* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

body:

Tokyo was not the first place he was summoned to so he is knowledgeable about the cultures and customs of many other worlds, and he used to be a king, meaning that his leadership skills are exceptional. His emerald bejeweled Decorative Sword Sacred Artifact secrets holy oil. He rubs it all over his body to engage in Turkish oil wrestling. A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the 1987 photo novel [[Gundam Sentinel]].

A mass-produced general purpose heavily armed and armored [[Mobile Suit]] with a design inspired by [[the_o_(mobile_suit)|The O]], fielded by a rogue group of [[Earth Federation]] officers and former members of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] called The New Desides. The Xeku has 3 configuration types for close, mid and long distance combat.

It was designed in [[real life]] by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: ritual_baton
body:
A long and flat scepter, often made from bamboo. It originates from ancient China, where it originally served as an object to write on. It is strongly associated with ancient noblemen, [[shinto]] priests, and [[hina ningyou]].

Known as [i]shaku[/i] in Japanese and [i]hu[/i] in Chinese. 

[[enma_(mythology)|Enma]]'s [[rod of remorse]] is a variant of this ritual baton.

title: anihilate_uroboros
body:
A level boss character from the [[Strider (video game)]] arcade machine released by [[Capcom]] in 1989.

[b]Anihilate Uroboros[/b] is a massive [[robot]] monster with an elongated serpent like body and a humanoid upper section, armed with a [[hammer and sickle]] in both hands.

Its name comes from the [i]Ouroboros[/i] (or Uroborus), an ancient symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail. The name originates from within Greek language; οὐρά (oura) meaning "tail" and βόρος (boros) meaning "eating", thus "he who eats the tail".

Inspired by the [[real life]] [[Ouroboros]], a symbol that represents the perpetual cyclic renewal of life, infinity and the eternal return. It also represents the cycle of life, death and rebirth, leading to immortality (as in the [[phoenix]] myth).

title: ouroboros
body:
An ancient Eastern European symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail. What is represents is debated and may vary from artist to artist. Common interpretation are that of eternity, cyclic nature of life and death and self destruction. 

h4. See also
* [[Anihilate Uroboros]]
* [[Tiger & Bunny]]
* [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]
* [[The Neverending Story]]

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ouroboros":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ouroboros

title: qubeley_mk_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]AMX-004-2/3 Qubeley Mk-II[/b]

An improved version of the [[Qubeley]] [[mobile suit]] deployed by [[Neo Zeon]]. The two units produced featured minute improvements over the original, notably two extra funnels, for a total of 12 remote weapons, and a three-pronged beam saber. The first unit produced was a purplish blue with black and pink vents, intended to be piloted by [[Elpeo Puru]]. The second was orange or red with yellow vents, and was piloted by [[Puru Two]].

h4.See also
* [[Qubeley Mass Production Type]]

title: qubeley
body:
A fictional antagonist [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985 and also appears in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-004 Qubeley[/b]

A revolutionary Newtype use [[mobile suit]] produced by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. By miniaturizing the original psycommu system from the [[Elmeth]] and perfecting the [[funnels_(gundam)|"funnel"]] remote weapons, it combines overwhelming firepower and mobility in a normal-sized MS. The formidable Qubeley served as Haman Karn's personal machine in both [[Zeta Gundam|The Gryps Conflict]] and [[Gundam ZZ|The First Neo Zeon War]], and it was regarded as a fearsome, nigh-unstoppable unit even when pitted against the almost impractically powerful [[ZZ Gundam]].

The [[Qubeley Mk II]] is a later variant, piloted by [[Elpeo Puru]] and later [[Puru Two]].

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Nagano Mamoru]].

h4.See also
* [[Qubeley Mass Production Type]]

title: qubeley_mass_production_type
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]AMX-004G Qubeley Mass Production Type[/b]

A late mass produced variant of the [[Qubeley Mk II]] [[mobile suit]], with greatly increased funnel carrying capacity and two large back beam cannons, but reduced speed and maneuverability as a result of the added weight. 

The units were mostly piloted by the remainder of the clones of [[Elpeo Puru]], with the exception of [[Puru Two]].

title: rick_dias
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]RMS-099 Rick Dias[/b]

The [[AEUG]]'s first original [[space]] combat "second generation" [[mobile suit]] design, taking in traditional aspects of [[Zeon]] MSs (the [[Rick Dom]] mostly) and pioneering new solutions such as the 360 degree monitors and the ejectable head-mounted cockpit. It was developed and produced by [[Anaheim Electronics]].

A red unit was initially piloted by [[Quattro Bajeena]], which sparked the fear of [[char_aznable|The Red Comet]] of old in the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]; once the AEUG became aware of this, all subsequent Rick Dias units moved on from the old black and grey (resembling the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]]) to the new red, so as to capitalize on the psychological impact of the color. Other notable AEUG Rick Dias pilots include Quattro's loyal wingmen, [[Apolly Bay]] and [[roberto_(gundam)|Roberto]].

After [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]] some red colored [[Schuzrum Dias]] variants were used by [[Neo Zeon]] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]].

h4.Related MS development
* [[Rick Dias II]]
* [[Dijeh]]

title: ecce_homo
body:
An early 20th-century fresco of [[Jesus]] by Elías García Martínez in Borja, Zaragoza, Spain

 In August 2012 news broke about a restoration attempt by Cecilia Giménez, a woman in her 80s. BBC correspondent Christian Fraser said, "the once-dignified portrait now resembles a crayon sketch of a very hairy monkey in an ill-fitting tunic". It has now jokingly been dubbed "Ecce Mono", or "Behold the Monkey". Others have referred to it as "[[potato jesus (meme)|Potato Jesus]]".

More generally, [i]Ecce Homo[/i] is Latin for "Behold the Man", a phrase spoken by Pontius Pilate at the trial of Christ.  There are also various art works with this title other than Martínez's.

title: aeug
body:
A fictional [[military]] organization from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]Anti Earth Union Group[/b] ([i]Hanchikyū Rempō Soshiki[/i]), more commonly known by their acronym as the [b]AEUG[/b] ([i]E~ūgo[/i]), [b]AG[/b] or more correctly translated, the [b]Anti United Earth Government Group[/b], is the main protagonist faction of Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam]] and Mobile Suit [[Gundam ZZ]]. The AEUG is an anti-Federation movement which initially opposed the oppressive [spoilers]genocidal[/spoilers] tactics of the Federation's elite [[titans_(gundam)|Titans taskforce]]. It was formed by [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] and [[Zeon]] One Year War veterans mostly and was founded and commandered by [[Blex Forer]] while supplied by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. They have several large [[military]] [[spacecraft]] and [[mobile suit]]s in its ranks. The [[Argama]] is the flagship of the AEUG.

[b]Karaba[/b] was a smaller Earth based resistance organization allied with the AEUG in its fight against the Titans. The [[Dijeh]] is a notable MS produced and deployed by this faction that was used by [[amuro_ray|a legendary figure]] from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War.]]

During [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]] both the AEUG and Karaba fought against [[Neo Zeon]]. [spoilers]At the end of this conflict the remaining AEUG/Karaba forces were integrated into the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] and became the core of the famous [[char's_counterattack|Londo Bell Unit]].[/spoilers]

title: operation_ten-gou
body:
[b]Operation Ten-Go[/b] was the last major Japanese naval offensive in [[World War II]] that took place on 7 April 1945. The operation occurred during the [[Battle of Okinawa]] and was a last desperate attempt by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to slow down the advancement of the Allied forces into [[Japan]], which ended in a defeat as the Americans' air superiority dominated the battle, leading to the sinking of the Japanese battleship [[Yamato_(battleship)|]] as well as other ships while the American aircraft that attacked them only suffered minuscule losses.

title: kaga_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Kaga[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], [[tsurime]] [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a black [[muneate]] over a [[white kimono]] top and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], blue [[tasuki]], brown [[apron]] based on the stern end of her flight deck, with the kana "カ" inscribed on it, [[black thighhighs]], and [[platform footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is very similar to [[akagi (kancolle)|Akagi's]] (and, by extension, all of Shibafu's carriers') own gear: a traditional [[yumi (bow)|yumi bow]], a [[quiver]] with a replica of the ship's mast, her full flight deck attached as a [[shield]] on her left arm and carrier-like [[geta]]. 

She has a stoic personality. In fan works, she is often paired with [[Akagi (kancolle)|]] or [[Zuikaku (Kancolle)|]]. She is sometimes portrayed as having high body temperature or being warm to the touch, due to the fact that the [i]Kaga[/i] was a converted battleship and was prone to overheating due to poor ventilation.

The historical [i]Kaga[/i] was originally designed as a battleship before being converted into a carrier. She was scuttled after being heavily damaged at the [[Battle of Midway]] in 1942.

title: arashio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Arashio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown_eyes|brown]] or [[yellow_eyes|yellow]] eyes. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]]. 

She is often giggling and trying to act sexy (like [[Kisaragi (Kancolle)|]]), but she looks more cute rather than sexy. 

The historical [i]Arashio[/i] was completed in December 1937 and sunk in March 1943 during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.

title: akagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Akagi[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long,]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She is typically seen wearing a [[muneate]] over white and red [[japanese clothes]] in a [[nontraditional miko]] style with a red [[tasuki]]. She also wears an apron based on the stern end of her flight deck, with the kana "ア" inscribed on it. She wears white [[thighhighs]].

Her [[rigging]] includes notably less armor or machinery than most shipgirls. She holds a traditional [[Kyuudou]] [[bow_(weapon)|bow]] and has [[arrow (projectile)|]]s in a [[quiver]] slung over her shoulder by a strap which also has a replica of her ship's [[mast]]. On her right arm, she has her flight deck worn like a shield. She wears [[geta]]-like sandals that have carrier-like decks on them.

She is nicknamed the "Bauxite Queen" and portrayed as a [[glutton]]ous eater thanks to her reputation for eating up all the Bauxite reserves in your inventory.

title: kongou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Kongou[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] bunched into [[double bun|two braided buns]], and an [[ahoge]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[hakama short skirt|hakama skirts]] (hers is [[black skirt|black]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]]. 

Being historically constructed in England, she has peculiar speech habits which include using random English words. Her catchphrase (from her speech when firing) is "[[Burning_love_(phrase)|Burning Love!]]" This does not keep her English from being so grammatically incorrect and accented to nearly be incomprehensible.

Her excitable dere-dere nature and frequent demands for attention from the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]] lead her to being portrayed as being "protago-sexual" in fan works, falling in love with anyone who is the protagonist of a series. Her openness and one of her lines, "Hey! Admiral! [[It's OK to touch]], but there's a time and place for everything," has earned its own tag.

She is an avid drinker of [[black tea]], sometimes to the point of being addicted to the stuff (see pool #7461).

title: call_of_cthulhu
body:
Refers to two things: the 1926 short story that gives the [[Cthulhu Mythos]] its titular cosmic entity, [[Cthulhu]], and the tabletop role-playing game based on said mythos by Chaosium, often abbreviated as CoC, which has been releasing since 1981. For posts which refer to the short story specifically, tag it with the mythos tag.

In Japan, Call of Cthulhu is the predominant TRPG (table talk RPG) of choice in the 21st century, over Dungeons and Dragons which previously dominated TRPG circles there, building off the TRPG fan culture tradition of 'replays' (novelizations of sessions, often paired with visuals to go with the text) with play videos (prerecorded or live) on Niconico and YouTube (ex. [[Yukkuri-tachi no Cthulhu no Yobikoe]]). Combined with general continued popularity for 20th century western authors such as Lovecraft, an accessible and easy-to-learn 'Basic Roleplaying' system which allows players to shape the scenarios as they wish (leading to many non-combat/horror-oriented scenarios), publisher support, player-created tools (such as CCFOLIA), and domestically-exclusive scenarios, CoC dominates. In turn, this has resulted in much fanart based on Japanese scenarios.

h4. Call of Cthulhu-related tags

h5. Scenarios

* [[Kaikou (trpg scenario)|]]
* [[Kyouki Sanmyaku ~Jashin no Itadaki~]]
* [[Soap School]]

h5. Campaigns

* [[Call of Cthulhu TRPG Replay - Mitsukado Gakuen Game-bu no Boutokuteki na Katsudou]]
* [[Machigai Darake no Cthulhu Shinwa TRPG]]
* [[Rokujouhan no Natsu]]
* [[Yukkuri-tachi no Cthulhu no Yobikoe]]
* [[Yukkuri Youmu to Hontou wa Kowai Cthulhu Shinwa]]

* Dicebreaker: "Horror RPG Call of Cthulhu is bigger than D&D in Japan":https://www.dicebreaker.com/games/call-of-cthulhu-rpg/news/call-of-cthulhu-dnd-japan-rpg
* Polygon: "The many-tentacled reach of Call of Cthulhu, among Korea and Japan’s most popular RPGs":https://www.polygon.com/tabletop-games/23584476/coc-call-of-cthulhu-chaosium-popularity-korea-japan-translation

title: akishimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akishimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Toyoguchi Megumi]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair|grey]] [[asymmetrical hair]] [[short hair with long locks|with a long left lock]] that [[gradient hair|gradiates]] to [[brown_hair|brown]]. On either side of her head, she wears a [[leaf hair ornament]] over her ear.

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]] with a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]] under a [[purple dress|purple]] [[pleated dress]] and a [[blue bowtie]] around her neck. Like [[Hayanami (kancolle)|]] before her, she wears [[grey thighhighs|grey]] or [[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[side-seamed legwear|seamed]] [[thighhighs]] instead of a pantyhose in her base form. Her damaged CG reveals she wears [[orange panties|orange]] underwear underneath her uniform. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3709147: Base
* !post #7042769: [[Akishimo (new year) (kancolle)|Haregi Mode/New Year]]

h4. History
The historical destroyer was sunk during a US Navy carrier strike on Manila alongside [[Akebono (kancolle)|]] on November 14, 1944. Hatsuharu, Satsuki, Okinami, Kiso, and Nachi were also sunk in the same area.

title: shin'you_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort carrier [i]Shin'you[/i]. Character designed by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]].

Being originally German, she has  [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her hair is tied to the left with a [[hair ornament]] that resembles a [[disposable cup]].

Her base outfit is almost identical to [[Kasuga Maru (Kancolle)|]]'s, wearing a white [[dougi]] top with a red [[hakama short skirt]], only to differentiate by wearing a yellow undershirt and [[yellow socks]] as opposed to Kasuga Maru's black.  On her left hand, she wears a thick falconry [[gloves|glove]]. 

The historical [i]Shin'you[/i] was originally the SS [i]Scarnhorst[/i], a German passenger liner. [i]Scharnhorst[/i] was stuck in Japan when [[World War II]] broke out in Europe. The Imperial Japanese Navy converted her into an escort carrier based on the plans for the [i]Taiyou[/i]-class carriers, much like [[Kasuga Maru (kancolle)|]]'s conversion. She was sunk in 1944 by torpedo attack from the submarine USS [i]Spadefish[/i].

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[German Escort Princess]].

title: uchiwa
body:
Originally from China, the uchiwa is a round or oval [[hand fan]] made of paper or silk pasted over a framework of thin bamboo strips.

With [[hand fan writing|a message written on it]], it is sometimes used in [[oshi-katsu]] as a lightweight placard.

Not to be confused with [[tuanshan]], another type of round hand fan.

h4. See also

* [[folding fan]]
* [[paper fan]]
* [[uchiwa (medium)]]

title: gene_(god_hand)
body:
The main protagonist of [[God Hand]].

[b]Gene[/b] is a young man wearing a tight [[white shirt]] and [[black coat]] with the left sleeve ripped at the forearm and the right ripped off completely, with shin-length [[coattails]] and [[black pants]]. He has an [[Handkerchief|orange handkerchief]] tied around his collar. Gene also wears a silver belt buckle and long black [[boots]], and dons a set of braces on his tattooed right arm (his Godhand) adorned with skull shapes referred to as the "Deistic Brace", and a [[fingerless gloves|Fingerless glove]] on his left hand. His build is top-heavy and [[muscular_male|muscular]], and his hair is [[blonde hair|light brown]] and slicked back. His left cheek has a white square [[bandaid]], and his eyes appear to be [[brown eyes|brown]].

His Voice actor is: [[Beng spies]]

H4. Appearance 
* !asset #24824147: In-Game Appearance
* !post #7532462: Official Concept art, Depicted having [[silver hair]]

H4. See also
* [[Olivia (god hand)|Olivia]]

H4. External Links
* [God Hand Capcom Fandom Wiki: Gene](https://godhandcapcom.fandom.com/wiki/Gene)

title: vena_(cyborg_009)
body:
Vena is a character from the series Cyborg 009: The Cyborg Soldier, she is one of the 5 princesses of the Yomi Kingdom.
Physically, she looks just like her sisters, with short, bristly orange-red hair and bright, solid-colored eyes with no visible sclerae or pupils, only Vina has green eyes.
In dress, she is distinguished by her tiara has a blue gem, blue jumpsuit and red shoes.
Vena stands out among her sisters for her strong and serious character, contrasting with her older sister, Helen.

title: admiral_brickell
body:
Admiral Brickell is a hero who first appears in [[bloons_tower_defense|Bloons TD 6]]. She is the tenth character to be released for that game generation.
Like most Bloons characters she's a [[monkey_girl|monkey]] with dark [[thick_eyebrows|thick eyebrows]] and [[brown_fur|brown fur]]. 
Her default outfit consists of a navy-colored [[naval_uniform|naval uniform]] with golden stripes complimenting her rank, beneath a [[peaked_cap|peaked cap]] she has long [[grey_hair|grey hair]] tied in a [[low_ponytail|low ponytail]].

title: jamaica_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Jamaica[/i] (pennant number 44).

Historically saw service escorting [[Duke of York (Azur Lane)|]] in the battle of North Cape and [[Victorious (Azur Lane)|]] in carrier airstrikes against [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]].
Was modernized for Pacific service against the IJN (alongside [[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]]), but the war ended before she could be transferred.
Later saw service in Korea before being decommissioned and scrapped by 1960.

title: west_virginia_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleship USS [i]West Virginia[/i] (BB-48) in [[Azur Lane]].

h4. Appearance
Her original design by [[Rail (Silverbow)]] (post #2975385) portrays her with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[orange eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[peaked cap]], eye[[glasses]], [[black gloves]], a white top, [[black dress]], [[miniskirt]], and [[garter straps|garter strap]] [[thighhighs]].
Her rig consists of two sides, each with two 406 mm twin mounts and a funnel.

Her revised design by [[Chuzenji]] (post #3297426) radically changes her form, now sporting [[pale skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[red eyes]].
Her outfit was changed to a [[black jacket]] strapped around a [[black dress]] and a secondary white outer dress, while her [[black gloves]] remain intact from the original. She also wears black [[rudder footwear]].
Her rig was also changed to better reflect the real-life namesake, with two 406 mm twin mounts per side and her cage mast and CXAM [[radar]] holding the two sides together.

h4. History
In real life, [i]West Virginia[/i] was among the battleships sunk in Pearl Harbor, moored outboard of [[Tennessee (Azur Lane)|]] and thus took the brunt of the damage. Refloated in May 1942, she was modernized in the West Coast in a style similar to the Tennessee-class: turning their superstructures into a compact form reminiscent of [[South Dakota (Azur Lane)|]]. Unlike the two Tennessee-class ships, the scale of her damage and modernization meant she only reentered active service in mid-1944, in time for the battle of Leyte Gulf. Here, she led the battle line that engaged "Nishimura's fleet":/pools/9549 in the last battleship-to-battleship engagement in history, firing the opening shots against [[Yamashiro (Azur Lane)|]] from 20.8 km out and Mogami from Artillery bombardment, knocking the Heavy Cruiser out of action.

Later seeing service in Iwo Jima and Okinawa, she was decommissioned in 1947 and scrapped 12 years later.

h4. Skins

* !post #3297426: Default
* !post #6597946: [[west_virginia_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)|Retrofit]]
* !post #6597999: [[west_virginia_(scenic_rhapsody)_(azur_lane)|Scenic Rhapsody]]

title: estoc_(weapon)
body:
A type of long, slender thrusting [[sword]] with a cruciform hilt and a grip for two-handed use, used in the late Medieval and Renaissance period. Essentially a type of highly specialized [[long sword]], the blade of an estoc is very stiff and usually has a diamond-shaped cross section. Because any edge on an estoc's blade is usually vestigial, it is unsuited to cutting but excels at thrusting and as an anti-armor weapon.

h4. See also
* [[Longsword]]

title: xenogears
body:
JRPG developed and published by Squaresoft (now Square Enix) for the Sony [[Playstation 1]]. Released on February 11, 1998 in Japan and on October 21, 1998 in North America.

It is part of the Xeno metaseries alongside [[Xenosaga]] and [[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]].

The story follows the protagonist [[Fei Fong Wong]] and several others in a journey to overthrow the rule of Solaris, an advanced tyrannical society floating in the sky. The game features [[mecha]] called Gears.

title: shirahoshi
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Princess Shirahoshi is a [[giantess|giant]] smelt-whiting [[mermaid]] and the princess of the Fish-Man Island.

The daughter of [[neptune_(one_piece)|Neptune]] and [[otohime_(one_piece)|Otohime]], she has three older brothers; [[Fukaboshi]], [[Ryuuboshi]] and [[Manboshi]] as well as a pet shark [[Megalo]].

[spoiler]Unbeknownst to her and those around her, she is the modern incarnation of "Poseidon", one of the three Ancient Weapons that is said to be capable of destroying the world. "Poseidon" being the power of communicating and controlling the Sea Kings, gigantic and powerful sea creatures.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Fandom: Shirahoshi":http://onepiece.fandom.com/wiki/Shirahoshi

title: charlotte_pudding
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Pudding is the 76th child of [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]], an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, and a hybrid between a human and a member of the Three-Eye Tribe.

She is initially arranged to be married with [[Sanji (one piece)|]] as a part of the regicide plan against the Vinsmoke family, but ended up genuinely fallen in love with him for real in the events of Whole Cake Island Arc.

Her most defining feature is her [[third eye]] on her forehead, which is usually covered by her bang. 

Having consumed the Memo Memo no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can turn people's memories into strips of film and manipulate them.

title: g10n_fugaku
body:
An [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] ultra-long range heavy bomber project developed during [[World War II]]. As with other bombers, it received mountain-related name, in this case the plane was named after [[Mount Fuji]].

The plane was designed as a part of Project Z, a project of the IJN to develop a heavy bomber capable of reaching the American mainland (much like Germany's "own project":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinkel_He_277] and, inversely, [[XB-35|the]] [[B-36 Peacemaker|American's]]). Due to the lack of materials and worsening war situation of Japan, the project was ultimately cancelled in 1944.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nakajima G10N":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_G10N]

title: anchor_(nikke)
body:
Character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of the [[Aegis (nikke)|Aegis squad]] alongside [[Helm (nikke)|]] and [[Mast (nikke)|]]. 

A Nikke from Aegis squad, who is passionate about marine life. She is equipped with high-performance radar detectors inside her body, so she has made a significant contribution to the Admire's voyage and combat. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[small breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[wet]] [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[serafuku]], [[headband]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[white thighhighs]].

Illustrator: [[Mikan03_26]]

h4. Appearance

title: mast_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of the [[Aegis (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Helm (nikke)|]] and [[Anchor (nikke)|]].

Mast has longed to hit the high seas ever since she first saw the swashbuckling adventures portrayed in pirate films as a child. As time drew on, however, her soul-crushing tenure at the Naval Squad slowly made her disillusioned. Even so, her vibrant personality remains untarnished, and she always brightens everyone else's day aboard the ship she serves. She is often accompanied by a [[parrot]] named [[Morgan (nikke)|]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair|black]]/[[pink hair]] tied in a [[twintails]] along with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit is a [[military uniform]] consisting of [[white shirt]] exposing her [[black bikini top]] with her [[white jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] are hanging on her shoulders, [[choker]], [[peaked cap]], [[black gloves]], [[white shorts]] and a pair of [[high heels]].

Illustrator: [[DFM (darknessdfm)|DarknessDFM]]

h4. Appearance

Her default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] top with [[armpit cutout]]s and an [[aiguillette]], [[white shirt|white]] undershirt for the bust, [[red skirt]], [[red boots|red]] [[knee boots]], and [[white gloves]].

title: hoolay_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A non-playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] boss character, appearing with the 2.4/2.5 Trailblaze Continuance story. 

While he is normally portrayed as a [[wolf|Borisin]], his species, he is also shown in a disguised [[fox boy|Foxian]] form. His disguised attributes are [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], white [[beard]], [[fox ears]], a [[muscular]] build, and a [[chest tattoo]] on his left pectoral. He also wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue shirt]] in the [[hadanugi dousa]] style, [[bandages]] on his chest, [[grey pants]], and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]].

title: unryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Unryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied into a long [[braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Despite [[unryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|her]] design being based off [i]Hiryuu[/i], she has a starkly different guise because she spent her final sortie in Chinese waters.

Her default base outfit consists of a [[blue vest|blue]] and [[white vest]] with green trim, [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] and [[green thighhighs]] along with greaves and [[platform footwear|platform]] [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. Most parts of her clothes have cloud-like patterning as a reference to her name ([i]Cloud Dragon[/i]). Her [[rigging]] is based off her real-life bridge and platforms with several [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, which can be operated with a built-in trigger, while she uses a [[staff]] for her shikigami aircraft with her real-life [[flight deck]] used as a banner. 

She is depicted as a highly calm individual, with degrees of her "coolness" varying in several fan works. Some depict her as stoic and somewhat air-headed, others as very ladylike and quiet, or even almost [[expressionless]] in some cases.

title: gregory_house
body:
Gregory House is a fictional character and the titular protagonist of the American medical drama series [[house m.d.|House]]. Created by David Shore and portrayed by English actor Hugh Laurie.

Head of the Department of Diagnostic Medicine at Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital, with specialties in both Infectious Disease and Nephrology. House did his undergrad at Johns Hopkins; he also attended medical school there but was expelled for cheating and ultimately got his degree from the University of Michigan. House is a brilliant doctor; unfortunately for everyone around him, he's also a misanthrope and an arrogant jerk to everyone he meets. He walks with a [[cane]] as a result of an infarction he suffered in his right thigh and the surgery that tried to correct it; the pain from this drives his Vicodin addiction as well.

title: sakura_laurel_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A positive-thinking umamusume with a sunny disposition. Although she is sickly by nature and injury-prone due to her fragile legs, she always came back from her setbacks and never gets discouraged. She has a peculiar rivalry with Narita Brian. She also dreams of winning the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, becoming a francophile as a result.

Before she was made playable and thus, had her characterization settled, she was usually portrayed in fan-art as a [[yandere|manic obsessive-possessive]] rival to Narita Brian.

Laurel has her own spin-off manga titled [i][[Umamusume: Star Blossom]][/i].

title: duramente_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a white streak on her forehead as well as an [[ahoge]]. She comes from a family of athletes and grew up with [[Air Groove (umamusume)|]], whom she calls "Gurunee" (グル姉).

She was first introduced as a surprise to viewers watching the premiere of the 3rd season of the [i]Umamusume[/i] anime, where she beat protagonist [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]] and [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|]]. Duramente's introduction to the story sent shockwaves among the fanbase, as this meant that other horses of the same owner (Sunday Racing) could now be part of the world of [i]Umamusume[/i]; especially since up to that point the horse was substituted by an original NPC named [[Brusquement_(umamusume)|]].

title: air_groove_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

Vice President of the Tracen Academy Student Council. Frequently the victim of [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s [i]horrible[/i] puns.

Air Groove's official character profile originally had a line mentioning that "she hates men because of a certain traumatic incident in a race" (レース中のとあるトラウマが原因で男嫌い). This was a reference to the 1997 Japan Cup incident where another horse, Pilsudski, won the race in front of Air Groove in spite of said horse flashing at the paddock in front of the crowd (and other horses including Air Groove), which is normally seen as a sign of distraction by Japanese horse racing fans. This line was subsequently removed, but the incident is still referenced in Air Groove's relationship with [[Fine Motion (Umamusume)|]], as the real-life Fine Motion is the half-sister of [[Pilsudski (Racehorse)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: mayano_top_gun_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. 

A little Maverick of a throughbred, Mayano Top Gun is a young-looking [[horse girl]] who is named as well as having part of her personality based around the movie [[Top Gun]]. When she isn't spouting aeronautical references, she is trying (too hard) to be [[age_conscious|treated as an adult]], yet despite of this she is notably capable of learning quick and is able to grasp the situation such as answering a math question. This is reflected in-game where she is capable of running in different strategies.

Her racing outfit was influenced by the movie [[Top Gun]] (her jacket is nearly identical to that worn by [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]]). When it came to promote [[Top Gun: Maverick]] (or, rather, due to her very presence), she was the natural choice to "advertise the movie":[/posts/5348482].

h4. Appearance

title: symboli_rudolf_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Student Council President of Tracen Academy.

Rudolf is infamous for having a penchant for cracking horrible 'dad joke'-level puns. This causes [[Air Groove (Umamusume)|]] (her vice-president) no end of grief.

Japanese fan artists may also sometimes draw a younger version of Rudolf, which they name "Luna". This nickname is derived from the actual childhood name of the real-life [[Symboli Rudolf (racehorse)|]].

title: fine_motion_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. An exchange student from Ireland who comes from a distinguished family. Loves [[Ramen]].

Unlike all the other [[horse girl]]s, Fine Motion has completely symmetrical [[hair ornament]]s. These consist of four [[clover]]-shaped [[clover hair ornament|hair ornament]]s (three-leaved clovers, each colored in red and outlined in green) arranged in two identical pairs on top of her head, with one pair of clovers each in front of both her left and right ears.

Fine Motion's real-life counterpart is widely rumored to be intersex (appears to be a mare but has male chromosomes and testes). Note that otherwise, she would be treated as a "filly/mare" character (wears [[buruma]] with her [[gym uniform]] and the such) as the original horse ran as one.

title: agnes_digital_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

Digital (referred in game as Digi-tan) is a diehard otaku fan of umamusume (analogous to idol otaku in real life). As such she is often found fangirling over her fellow schoolmates/colleagues. She is also frequently depicted cheering or observing the other uma girls from the side, often waving glowsticks around (like RL idol otaku). This trait of hers is exaggerated in fanart, where she will often react violently (i.e. heart attack, massive nosebleed, exploding) [[so_moe_i'm_gonna_die!|to whatever wholesome or adorable event she deems "precious".]] Because of it, she is easily seen both in fanarts or in game, watching other umammusumes or ending up interacting with them.

Her portrayal as an otaku is due to the RL horse's nickname of "Deviant Horse" or "Hentai Horse", referring to the horse's success as a Jack-of-all-trades (and not any particular sexual attraction to other horses). In the game, she thrives on all terrains as well as Mile and Medium distances and is relatively well balanced on stats.

h4. Appearance

title: hishi_akebono_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident tall girl of the series and American-born returnee. Voiced by [[Matsuzaki Rei]].

Akebono's most salient trait is her massive height at 180 cm (5' 11''). As such she is frequently depicted towering above other characters, both in canon and fanart. Fanart tend to pair her with the some of the shortest characters (e.g. [[Nishino Flower_(umamusume)|]]) to further highlight this [[height difference|disparity]]. Her special ability also involves growing into a donut-giving [[giantess]], playing further more with her size.

h4. Appearance

title: nishino_flower_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]

The obligatory gifted [[child]] character. She is the shortest character overall at 135 cm but this is justified by being [i]an actual preadolescent child[/i]. She is often paired with [[Hishi Akebono_(umamusume)|]], the tallest and largest horse girl of Tracen (at 180 cm tall), simply for the [[height_difference|sheer contrast in size]]. She is also often paired with [[Seiun Sky_(umamusume)|]] due to their real-life relationship (Same owner and one of the few opportunities for Seiun Sky to actually mate as an unpopular stud).

title: king_halo_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i] and resident "ojou" of the series. As her name says, acts like a haughty noble but she is a good person in heart. Often paired with [[Haru Urara (umamusume)|Urara]] who is her roommate or usually Seiun Sky. 

She is infamous for being one of the hardest characters to train in the game due to the wide range of distances she is expected to race on. Thankfully, she is at least competent in all distances (A-B-B-C). She also becomes a member of Team Ascella, supporting [[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|]] and [[Cesario (umamusume)|]] in their races.

title: mejiro_mcqueen_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. A lady from the prestigious Mejiro family, Mejiro McQueen is the resident [i]Ojou-sama[/i] character of the series. While she strives to be as prim and proper as she can, she has to deal with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] antics as well as her own sweet tooth. While she was a supporting character in the first season of the anime, she became the deuteragonist for the second season, sharing the spotlight with [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]] and exploring the Mejiro family in more detail. In the mobile game, she is the main character as well as the first member of Team Sirius, after [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]] retired.

title: ikuno_dictus_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

The "Iron Lady". While she is originally nicknamed as such for the original horse's long career and unusual sturdiness despite her leg injuries in her youth, this version is nicknamed for taking logistics, her own as well as others, with stone cold seriousness due to said leg injuries. The original horse was named after her sire, Dictus, of whom, his descendants usually inherit his belligerent personality and his distictive leer... [i]usually[/i]. She is part of Team Canopus in the anime, acting as the brains of the team.

title: nice_nature_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Nice Nature sees herself as the most normal and sane member of the team but she instead comes off as the most insecure, basically citing the original horse's collection of third places. Personality-wise she is notably seen as an unassuming, unambitious, and laidback character, opting not to be overly expressive in most scenarios. Despite her laidback attitude, she takes racing very seriously. Whether she wins or loses, she doesn't let anything go to her head. Although not often, when she does express herself, she tends to get embarrassed rather easily (usually in front of her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]])

title: baritone_saxophone
body: The baritone saxophone is a woodwind [[instrument]]. It is the largest and lowest-pitched instrument in the [[saxophone]] family in common use.

title: saxophone
body:
A musical instrument that is popular in jazz, classical, and funk music. Comes in four popular sizes (listed from smallest to largest): soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone. (Smaller and larger variations of the soprano and baritone exist, but they are very rarely used.)

[[alto saxophone|Alto]]: Most commonly used and often in small jazz groups as well as large ensembles. Most distinct feature is that the neck is straight where the mouthpiece is attached. Convenient in size for generally all player heights, standing or sitting. 

 [[tenor saxophone|Tenor]]: Slightly larger with the physical distinction being the curved neck. Second most common and can be just as essential as the alto. 

 [[baritone saxophone|Baritone]]: Largest and with a deep bass-like sound, the neck has a complete loop. The size and the weight is considerably harder to maneuver than the rest. They are less common than the prior two, but can be still seen in large wind ensembles and medium to large jazz groups to provide bass depth.

[[soprano saxophone|Soprano]]: The look and posture it is held is almost exactly like a [[clarinet|clarinet]]. Mostly used as a solo instrument in classical or orchestral environments, or in a saxophone quartet.

title: hasu_no_sora_school_uniform
body:
The uniform of the Hasu no Sora Girls' High School from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[medium dress|medium-length]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[brown dress|brown]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a [[neckerchief]] with the color indicating the grade of the student (rotating between [[red neckerchief|red]], [[aqua neckerchief|aqua]], and [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]]) and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. In school, they wear color-coded [[uwabaki]] matching their neckerchief. In especially cold days, students may wear a [[black coat|black]] [[collared coat]] over their uniform. 

The [[summer uniform]] instead features a [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short-sleeved]] [[blue dress|blue-ish]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[breast pocket]] on the wearer's left. 

Note that in live performances, the cast usually wear only the skirt part of the winter uniform along with a themed t-shirt in encores.

Unlike the other entries of Love Live!, they don't change their neckerchiefs to other colors when they move up a class. 

h4. Examples
* !post #7452192: Winter uniform
* !post #7515584: Black collared coat
* !post #7503740: Summer uniform
* !post #8734082: Live shirt example

h4. See also

* [[Otonokizaka school uniform]]
* [[Uranohoshi school uniform]]
* [[Nijigasaki school uniform]]
* [[Yuigaoka school uniform]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: celestial_dragons_(one_piece)
body:
The [b]Celestial Dragons[/b], also known as the [b]World Nobles[/b], are the aristocratic descendants of nineteen of the First Twenty kingdoms who established what is now known as the World Government. Due to their elite status within the World Government, they are serving as the major antagonists of [[One Piece]].

Most of the Celestial Dragons are often seen with an astronaut-like outfit with its own air supply, ostensibly to prevent the "impure" air that the commoner breathe to "contaminate" them.

h4. See also
* [[Gorosei]]

title: carrot_hamburger_steak
body: A dish consisting of at least one [[hamburger steak]] patty, but typically three patties stacked on top of each other, with a [[carrot]] planted deep in the middle. It's an iconic dish of the [i][[Umamusume]][/i] franchise.

title: lynn_minmay
body:
A female character from the [[MACROSS]] franchise, originally spelled as Linn Minmei.

She is one of the main characters from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie, in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and in the [[Macross: The First]] [[comic]]. 

[b]Lynn Minmay[/b] is a sweet, flighty and insecure teenage pop [[idol]] born in Yokohama Chinatown, Japan (though she is of partial Chinese descent).

In [[real life]] this very popular character was voiced by [[voice actor|voice actress]] "Mari Iijima":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mari_Iijima who became an instant celebrity and began her musical career during the series. 

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Hayase Misa]]

title: sdf-2_megaroad-01
body:
A massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA from 1987.

The [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]SDF-2 Megaroad-01 Class Super-Long Range Colonization Ship[/b] was originally going to be a bigger and better armed version of the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]]. However, after the end of [[choujikuu yousai macross|Space War I]] the ship was redesigned as the first of a series of massive colonization craft developed for the program of expansion of human civilization and culture across the [[galaxy]].

The SDF-2 can't transform and was designed with various minimal armaments to ensure more space was available for colonists and bigger life support systems. However, a large complement of [[mecha]], which included several [[destroid]]s and the brand new [[VF-4]] variable fighters, were onboard the new vessel. Also, a defense [[fleet]] composed of many Earth and [[Zentradi]] warships provided escort for the Megaroad. The Megaroad class ships were eventually succeded by the bigger and more advanced [[city 7|City Class Starships]]. 

The SDF-2 Megaroad-01 was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 1980s.

title: uraga_class_carrier
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction anime series.

The [b]Uraga Class Escort Battle Carrier[/b] is the next generation stealth carrier built to replace the Guantánamo Class Stealth Carriers in the Earth's military forces. 

The Uraga Class, built with weaponry, armor and maneuverability comparable to a cruiser, is often used as the flagship of small [[U.N. Spacy]] and [[N.U.N.S.]] fleets. 

At 550 meters long, the Uraga Class ships are much larger conventional spacecraft but still significantly smaller than the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]] or the later New Macross Class ships. The Uraga is built with a stealth composition superstructure and features a dual deck launching system for [[variable fighter]]s; one deck running the latter dorsal two-thirds of the ship and an internal deck underneath with a launching deck in the forward third. This efficient deck design allows rapid deployment of multiple craft simultaneously and has become common on many UN Spacy carrier vessels.

These ships are rare among colonization fleets due to their high costs compared to the [[ARMD]] carriers but the U.N.G. remains committed to replacing the older ARMD carriers one by one with Uraga Class ships. As more Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are built, they are poised to become the mainstay combat and carrier ship for the U.N. Spacy. Many Uraga Class vessels are part of the Earth's defense fleet and are found serving as command ships for large groups of [[Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier]]s and [[Northampton Class Stealth Frigate]]s. Several Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are also in active service as defensive stations docked to unarmed core ships.

In real life this ship was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

title: macross_scrambled_valkyrie
body:
[b]Chō Jikū Yōsai Macross: Scrambled Valkyrie[/b] is a 16-megabit, 2D shooter released on the [[Nintendo]] [[Super Famicom]] in 1993 and based on the 1984 animated movie The Super Dimension Fortress [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] 

The story takes place after the movie's ending but before the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]]. 

The game was developed by WinkySoft and published by Zamuse. It was only released in Japan.

title: macross_flashback_2012
body:
[b]The Super Dimension Fortress[/b] [[Macross]] [b]Flash Back 2012[/b] is a 1987 OVA collection of music videos from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] animated television series (1982-1983) and [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|: Do You Remember Love?]] theatrical film adaptation (1984). 

It also contains several minutes of new footage (with new [[mecha]], [[spacecraft]] and costume designs) that depicts story events that were initially planned but not animated for the endings of the television series (the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]] colonization ship captained by [[Hayase Misa]]) and the film (the final concert on Earth by [[Lynn Minmay]]).

h4. See also

* [[VF-4]]

title: brisket
body: A tough but incredibly flavorful cut of beef from the cow's chest. Its toughness is its strength, as it requires low and slow cooking methods to break down the connective tissue, resulting in incredibly tender, juicy, and flavorful meat that is a centerpiece of many cuisines, especially barbecue.

title: matzah
body: A type of unleavened flatbread that holds significant importance in [[Jewish]] tradition, especially during the holiday of [[Passover]] (Pesach).

title: passover
body: A major Jewish festival that commemorates the Biblical story of the Israelites’ Exodus from slavery in ancient Egypt. This story is recorded in the Hebrew Bible’s Book of Exodus. The holiday begins on the 15th day of the Hebrew month of Nisan and lasts for seven days in Israel (and among some liberal Jewish communities worldwide), or eight days in many traditional communities outside of Israel.

title: netflix
body:
An American video streaming platform, largely credited with popularizing the streaming format and contributing to the decline of the video rental market in America.

Initially founded as a mail-order DVD rental service, the company is more well known for its popular streaming service and has produced a number of original productions with some of them earning [[academy award of merit|Academy Awards]].

title: saria_(arknights)
body:
[i]Saria, former researcher of Rhine Lab, will serve as a core part of the squad's defense and healing unit on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]174 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Saria was once the director of the [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]] Defense Division, has made contributions to the fields of life science, microbiology, and Originium Arts and has also proven herself formidable when it comes to demolition, protection, and anomaly containment missions. She is currently working with Rhodes Island in various scientific fields and is negotiating a more in-depth cooperation plan with them.

Parted ways with Rhine Lab, LLC after a certain incident involving [[Ifrit (Arknights)|]] and her former colleague, [[Silence (Arknights)|]], with the latter ensuring Saria and Ifrit do not get the chance to interact with each other.

One of the supporting characters in the side story event [i]Mansfield Break[/i]. Uses calcification arts in addition to her healing and defensive capabilities.

Her motif is based on a Western dragon. Her callsign is derived from the mythical name of the "gray-haired mountain" Mount Hermon, located between the border of present-day Syria and Lebanon.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Iguchi Yuka]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3563856: Default
* !post #3563858: Elite II
* !post #3887634: [[Saria (Stronghold) (arknights)|Stronghold]]
* !post #4256503: [[Saria (The Law) (arknights)|The Law]]

title: silence_(arknights)
body:
[i]Silence, medical specialist of Rhine Lab, will make use of the latest scientific developments on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Olivia Silence

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 18[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]154 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An ex-Originium researcher at [[Rhine Lab (Arknights)|Rhine Lab, LLC]]. She was involved in several unknown applied research projects as well as several clinical trials on oripathy there, with [[Ifrit_(Arknights)|Ifrit]] as her test subject. After a horrendous incident at the lab, she left Rhine Lab and took Ifrit into her care and brought her to Rhodes Island, which possessed the only other facilities outside of Rhine Lab capable of containing an Oripathy case as seemingly severe as Ifrit's. She now provides battlefield medical treatments to Rhodes Island.

She deploys medical [[drone|drones]] in battle. Her motif is based on owls, specifically the [i]Great Horned Owl[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kitou Akari]].

body:

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

The defender of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1. She used to be a Columbian police cadet, alongside [[Fang (arknights)|]] and [[Kroos (arknights)|]].

Despite her clumsiness and immaturity in some respects, she displays professionalism, resilience and extreme talent. 

She likes to help other R.I. operators and her teammates, such as solving disputes between [[Lava (arknights)|]] and [[Hibiscus (arknights)|]], or helping Fang to find Kroos.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nana Harumura (JP), Wang Xiaotong (CN), Claire Morgan (EN) and Lee Hyun-jin (KR). Her illustrator is [[Xiayehongming]].

title: tyson_hesse
body:
American illustrator, comic artist, and animator, known for his prolific artistic contributions to official [i][[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]][/i] media. Created a [i]Sonic[/i] fan comic, titled [i]Sonic's Big Fat Adventure[/i], which earned him a position as an artist for the official [i]Sonic[/i] [[sonic the hedgehog (archie comics)|comic series]] published by Archie Comics. Has since served as artist and animation director for several [i]Sonic[/i] cartoon shorts, and became the character design lead for the [[Sonic (live action)|live-action]] film series following the negative reception to the [[Ugly Sonic|initial design]] of the first film's version of [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyson_Hesse]

title: hatterene
body:
[b]Hatterene[/b] (Japanese: [b]ブリムオン[/b] Brimuon) is a dual-type Psychic/Fairy [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] introduced in Generation VIII. It evolves from [[Hattrem]]. It is the final form of [[Hatenna]].

Much like [[Gardevoir]], it gained similar popularity due to its humanoid, feminine appearance, resembling a [[witch]] with a [[witch hat]]. Though unlike the former, Hatterene is exclusively female. Because of the similar notoriety, it is also often paired with Gardevoir, typically as a rival.

In some fanarts, Hatterene's "dress" (in actuality an extension to its "hair" appendages) is mistakenly depicted as the body of the Pokémon itself. The "actual" body of Hatterene is in fact disproportionally small, and can be visible above the "dress".

Hatterene has a [[Gigantamax]] form, [[Gigantamax Hatterene]].

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Hatterene (Pokémon)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Hatterene_(Pok%C3%A9mon)]

title: hiei_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Hiei[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] [[flipped hair|flipped back]], and [[purple eyes]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt]]s (hers is [[green skirt|green]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]].

She tends to be depicted as a fiery airhead girl who usually can be seen worshiping [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], her big sister. This leads to her frequently being portrayed as a lesbian, siscon, and at odds with the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]], either being indifferent to his presence or holding a deep, perhaps one sided rivalry with him due to her sister's unrelenting admiral love.

Her "{{pool:13812|Hiei Curry}}" featured in her hourlies, whether it is good or [[bad food|bad]] (usually the latter), is infamous for making the admiral run away for several hours. Oftentimes, her cooking is plain [[censored food]]. Has a tendency to yell out "Hieee-!" (written "ひえー！" or with a typographical variant), which sounds like her own name.

h4. Appearance

title: hellbender
body:
A species of [[giant salamander|giant]] [[salamander]] found in the eastern and central [[United States]].

They have flat bodies and heads, with beady dorsal eyes and slimy skin. They are blotchy brown or red-brown in color, with a paler underbelly.

title: salamander
body:
A common name for amphibians of the order Urodela. They are typically characterized by their slender bodies, short noses, and long tails.

In legend, they were associated with fire and several ancient writers believed they were born from fire or could consume or otherwise extinguish it with the cold(-blooded) bodies. Many fantastic works use them as a kind of fire elemental.

h6. Specific real-world salamanders

* [[Axolotl]]
* [[Giant salamander]]
* [[Hellbender]]

h6. Specific fantasy salamanders

* [[Salamander (Azazel-san)]]
* [[Salamander (Guardian Knights)]]
* [[Salamander (Mon-Musu Quest!)]]
* [[Salamander (Monster Girl Encyclopedia)]]
* [[Salamander (Seiken Densetsu)]]

h4. See also

* [[Lizard]], which salamanders are often confused with
* [[Gnome]], often serving as an earth elemental equivalent
* [[Sylph]], often serving as an air elemental equivalent
* [[Undine]], often serving as a water elemental equivalent

* [[Salamander (Game)]]

title: kamen_rider_zx
body:
The tenth [[Kamen Rider]] introduced during an anniversary TV special. His name is pronounced as "Zee-Cross".

After being abducted when his plane crashes, Ryou Murasame is made into the Badan Empire's agent of evil known as ZX until he suffers an accident that undoes his brainwashing. He escapes from Badan, encountering senior Riders. He is reluctant to trust them at first, but eventually joins them to destroy the Badan Empire, giving himself the name of Kamen Rider ZX.

ZX is based on a long-horn beetle and mostly colored red and white with a green scarf.

h4. See also

* [[Kamen Rider Spirits]]

h4. External links

* Special officially streaming on YouTube: "Subbed":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tc7CH1-5FpQ]

title: kotobukiya_bishoujo
body:
A popular figure line by [[Kotobukiya]] featuring bishoujo versions of pop culture icons. The series' character designer is [[Yamashita Shun'ya]]. In 2017, the company created a male counterpart to the line named the "[[kotobukiya ikemen|Ikemen Series]]", headed by bishounen versions of [[DC Comics]]' Bat Family designed by [[Ricken]].

title: haguro_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Haguro[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[bob cut]] and [[brown eyes]], with her [[hair ornament]] patterned off her real-life mainmast. She wears the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class purple [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], white [[pantyhose]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

She is the scaredy-cat of her class, often saying "I'm sorry". Her second remodel gives her enough self-confidence to be able to do something without apologizing and fight at her full potential.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1921379: Base and kai

title: rest_energy_(marina_abramovic_&_ulay)
body:
Rest Energy is a 1980 performance art piece by duo Marina Abramović and Ulay, portraying two people holding a [[bow (weapon)|]] with an [[arrow (projectile)|]] pointed to one person's heart.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rest Energy (performance piece)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_Energy_(performance_piece)

title: euphemism
body:
When an offensive, harsh or blunt expression is replaced with a mild, indirect or vague one. 

Visual euphemisms exist, too, such as the one used for [[Akiyama Mio]]'s accidental [[pantyshot]] in the [[K-On!]] anime (a stripped bowl of rice) or when [[swastika]] or the [[hammer and sickle]] are replaced with more innocuous symbols to avoid offending the audience and/or so the work won't run afoul of laws banning the public display of either symbols.

An orthographic euphemism is spelling a word deliberately wrong (e.g. "porn" becomes "pr0n", "n0rp" or "prawn") to circumvent censorship algorithms on the usenet, websites, social media apps, etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #8019284

h4. See also

* [[double entendre]]
* [[pun]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Unusual Euphemisms":[http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnusualEuphemism]

title: murasame_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Murasame[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black_serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of her funnel to her back, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount slung to the side, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Unlike the rest of her class however, she wields a melee weapon, that being a chained anchor that she utilizes as a [[flail]].

She has a very girly personality while being the most physically mature person among her sister ships. Has a habit of beginning her sentences with "hai hai" (はいはーい).

body:

The bleeding may come from a mortal internal injury, or simply from an injury to the mouth itself (cut lip, bit tongue, etc.).

title: dotsuitare_hompo
body:
A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Osaka division. It consists of the members [[Nurude Sasara]] (a comedian), [[Amayado Rei]] (a conman whose true identity is [spoilers]the father of the [[buster_bros!!!|Yamada brothers]] and the inventor of the Hypnosis Mic technology[/spoilers]), and [[Tsutsujimori Rosho]] (a teacher).

Sometimes referred to as Dotsuitare [i]Honpo[/i].

title: buster_bros!!!
body: A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Ikebukuro division. It consists of the [[brothers]] [[Yamada Ichiro]], [[Yamada Jiro]], and [[Yamada Saburo]].

title: halfling
body:
A humanoid race found in a number of [[fantasy]] settings, most notably [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. They're physically similar to humans, except about half as tall and not as stocky as the similarly sized [[dwarf|dwarves]]. They tend to be portrayed as stealthy and lucky.

Their general description and traits are typically derived from the hobbit race found in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

h4. See also

* [[Dwarf]]
* [[Elf]]
* [[Gnome]]
* [[Orc]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Halfling":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfling

title: dwarf
body:
A fantasy race of short, stocky humanoids. Classically depicted as resembling tiny old men, generally bearded. They are commonly associated with metalwork and mining.

Only apply this tag if the character depicted features the defining characteristics of a dwarf, such as significantly short stature (typically around child's height), bulky build relative to the height, etc.

h4. See also

* [[draph]]
* [[gnome]]
* [[halfling]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: sharpnelsound
body: The record label/doujin circle of DJ Sharpnel, a [[j-core]] duo. Their logo is a yellow S with a blue outline.

title: j-core
body:
Japanese hardcore techno scene associated with doujin music and rhythm games. Pioneered in the late 90s and early 2000s by duo [[sharpnelsound|DJ Sharpnel]], derived from the earlier [[Nerdcore Techno]] genre that J-core would come to overshadow. Today, J-core is popular around the world due to its use in games and online.

This tag should be used on posts that reference j-core artists, circles, songs or albums.

h4. See also

* [[Camellia (musician)|]]
* [[hardcore tano c|HARDCORE TANO*C]]
* [[t+pazolite]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: J-core":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J-core

title: vip_sensei_(meme)
body:
A Japanese [[meme]] based on a video of the [[Maschinenmensch]] from [[Metropolis (Fritz Lang)|]] dancing to a remix of a [[Super Mario RPG]] song. The video was originally posted by a Spanish blogger in 2005, before it caught the attention of VIPPERs from [[2channel]], who misheard the lyric "drives some peeps insane" as "VIP sensei".

h4. External links

* "Youtube: VIP Sensei":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gZo1BLYcMJ4
* "Know Your Meme: VIP Teacher":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/vip-teacher

title: araki_nonoka_(takano_tomohiro)
body: An original character by [[Takano Tomohiro]], introduced as an "enkou JK" or highschool girl doing underage paid dating. Her name, 荒木野々花 (Araki Nonoka), is derived from post #3910997, post #5370817, post #5398983, post #6047916, and post #6047918 as shown on her student ID card. Details on her Student ID: [Original] 千川代学園 氏名 荒木野々花 学籍番号 193T128078 生年月日 平成17年4月22日 住所 東京都西東京市 [Translation] Senkawadai Academy Name: Araki Nonoka Student Registry Number: 193T128078 Birth Date (y/m/d): 2006/4/22 Residence: Tokyo Metropolis West Tokyo City
